name: The Beginning of the Woody Years on "Cheers" Quiz | Television | 25 Questions

questions.text: In "Birth, Death, Love, and Rice" what is the "sign from God" that Diane gets?
questions.correct: Sam asks if there's a men's room in the convent
options: Sam asks Diane to marry him
Sam likes the food Diane cooks at the convent
questions.explanation:
Sam asks if there's a men's room in the convent.

	Diane entered the convent after leaving Frasier at the alter.

questions.text: In "Woody Goes Belly Up" what is Woody's girlfriend's name?
questions.explanation:
Beth.

	Kelly is Woody's girlfriend much later, and then his wife. Lucia and Seraphina are the names of two of Carla's children.

questions.text: In "Someday My Prince Will Come" what is the name of the man who leaves his Cashmere coat at "Cheers"?
questions.explanation:
Stuart.

	Stuart was played by Frank Dent. You may have also seen him as Mr. Egg in "Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead".

questions.text: Who plays Carla's son Anthony Tortelli?
questions.explanation:
Timothy Williams.

	Anthony is the oldest of Carla's eight children. He is dating and also married Annie who was played by Mandy Ingber.

questions.text: Andy Andy returns in "Diane's Nightmare." What do we find out is his real last name?
questions.explanation:
Shroeder.

	Derek McGrath plays Andy.

questions.text: What was the name of the first edition book that Diane buys for $500?
questions.explanation:
"The Sun Also Rises".

	Ernest Hemingway wrote all these books.

questions.text: Who plays Scotto the mime?
questions.explanation:
Don Lewis.

	Diane: 'Everyone loves a mime.'  Sam: 'Wrong, everyone hates a mime. Everyone loves a clown.'

questions.text: Who won the bowling tournament: "Cheers" or "Gary's Olde Town Tavern"?
questions.explanation:
Cheers.

	Woody was supposed to help them win, but he won't bowl because he once maimed a man. Diane is the one who steps in and helps them win.

questions.text: Whose father, played by Dick O'Neil, comes to "Cheers"?
questions.explanation:
Cliff's.

	Dick O'Neill was also in "The Jerk". He played Frosty, Navin's boss.

questions.text: When Diane does her paper on the "Don Juan Syndrome", who does she use as her subject?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	The "Don Juan Syndrome" refers to men that can't make a commitment to one woman.

questions.text: In "Fools and Their Money" what song did Woody and Sam sing together in the office?
questions.explanation:
Home on the Range.

	They sang this song because Coach had once told Sam that anyone who can sing "Home on the Range" for an hour and still be friends can get through any fight.

questions.text: In "Take My Shirt...Please" what does Sam donate to a celebrity auction?
questions.explanation:
baseball jersey.

	No one wants to buy Sam's jersey, until finally people feel sorry for it and buy it just to get it off the table.

questions.text: In "Suspicion" who gets a bucket of water dumped on her head?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	The water was the way the others got back at Diane when she used them as an experiment for school without telling them first.

questions.text: In "The Triangle" who asks Frasier for help to regain his confidence as a psychiatrist?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Diane and Sam want to help Frasier because he's been drinking too much.

questions.text: Complete this line spoken by Carla in "Cliffie's Big Score" "Great a night out with the ___________, the _________, and door number three."
questions.explanation:
stick, nerd.

	Diane is the stick. Cliff is the nerd. Cliff's friend from work, Lucas, was door number three.

questions.text: How does Frasier's date tell Frasier her name is spelled in "Second Time Around - Candi or Candy?
questions.explanation:
Candi.

	Candi was played by Jennifer Tilly. Jennifer Tilly was the voice of Celia in "Monsters, Inc."

questions.text: In "The Peterson Principle", does Norm get the job promotion?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Norm doesn't reveal that the boss' wife is having an affair with the other man up for the same promotion because he doesn't want to rat the man out. However, Norm doesn't get the position because Vera doesn't fit in with the other wives.

questions.text: In "Dark Imaginings" what does Sam worry about?
questions.explanation:
getting old.

	Sam played racquetball with Woody and not only loses but gets hurt. This makes Sam feel like he's old.

questions.text: Who does Carla win the dance contest with?
questions.explanation:
Nick Tortelli.

	At first Sam was her partner, but then she ditched Sam to dance with Nick and they won.

questions.text: Who wrote the episode "Fear is My Co-Pilot"?
questions.explanation:
Cheri Steinkellner  and Bill Steinkellner.

	Bill Steinkellner also did the screenplay for "Teacher's Pet". Cheri Steinkellner also helped with the screenplay for "Teacher's Pet".

questions.text: Which "Cheers" character didn't go to the opera on "Diane Chamber's Day"?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Diane thanks Carla for not being there, she thinks this was just another way to make it "Diane Chambers Day".

questions.text: Who plays Ken in "Relief Bartender"?
questions.explanation:
Tony Carreiro.

	Tony Carreiro played a cop in "Liar Liar."

questions.text: What is the name of the woman running for city council in "Strange Bedfellows" parts 1, 2, and 3?
questions.explanation:
Janet Eldrige.

	Kate Mulgrew who played Janet, was also in various episodes of "Star Trek" where she played Adm. Kathryn Janeway.

questions.text: Who guest starred as himself in "Strange Bedfellows II"?
questions.explanation:
Gary Hart.

	Gary Hart is a politician. He was once a US senator. His real name is Gary Warren Hartpence. He was born November 28, 1936.

questions.text: What happened at the end of "Strange Bedfellows III"?
questions.correct: Sam proposes to someone on the phone
options: Sam decides to run for city council himself
questions.explanation:
Sam proposes to someone on the phone.

	The end of this episode leaves viewers wondering if Sam call Diane or Janet to propose.
